page.title: 16Listed;New building:Cheshire
page.content: {Listed buildings.}This part of rural Cheshire has quite a number of listed buildings,especially round Saighton. The "Gatehouse" tower of Saighton Grange rates 2 stars & the rest is grade 2.Also grade 2 are the water tower;two boundary walls;the Old Vicarage,its gardens & walls;the building & rails outside the primary school.At Hatton Hall both the house & the causeway over the "Moat" are grade 2 & so is Faulkner's bridge over the canal.This ensures that they are not destroyed or changed much. {New property.}Except at Gatesheath there has been little 20th century building with only the very occasional new house or business premises eg.at Hatton Heath.Gatesheath has a small estate of post-war council houses (see page 4) & some smart detached 1960's houses with gardens.
